page.title: 09HOUSING IN BROMPTON
page.content: Brompton is built around a crossroads, a green and water meadow.95% of the houses are built of brick & 5% stone.20% of the housing is modern with central heating,but the rest still use solid fuel;about 45% are council owned.Nearly half the houses are terraced,these are the oldest in Brompton.They are built in the centre of the village & along the water meadow;most are built of stone and the rooves are slate.The terraced houses do not have front gardens.As you travel away from the centre of the village the housing styles change.About a third of the houses are semi_detached,these are built of brick.There are also detached houses, bungalows and maisonettes.The gardens are generally quite small.
